alert.note: Alert for White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 31 at 1:50PM MST until January 01 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM MST SATURDAY ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow and patchy blowing snow above 6500 feet. Snow showers will increase through the afternoon and evening, becoming steady overnight. Additional snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches, with higher amounts of 8 to 16 inches above 8000 feet. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph, leading to reduced visibility in areas of blowing snow. * WHERE...Areas above 6500 feet near Alpine, Pinetop-Lakeside and Show Low. * WHEN...Until 11 AM MST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute, as well as any New Year`s Eve travel plans. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Additional snow forecast from 1 PM Today to 11 AM Saturday: Alpine 6 to 10 inches Pinetop-Lkside 5 to 9 inches Show Low 2 to 4 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
